message: I'm a big fan of Hog Bay's Taskpaper and noticed people are working on a vim plugin for handling editing and messing around the text files it creates. One thing I miss though from the client is the ability to type in something like @week13 and not @done and have it filter all my tasks down. Willing to take a shot at creating that function though not familiar with vim syntax too much. Can anyone think of a similar plugin that allows something like :tpf @week14 and not @done and can point me to the source? I figure if I can get the basic boolean working the filtering should be easy.
Easy, as in... I'll only create minor brain damage to myself beating my head against the desk building it... =p
Are you familiar with python or ruby? No reason vim plugins can't be written in those languages for the most part.
